page.title: 07Recreation Fishing Meon
page.content: The river Meon flows alongside Droxford on its way to Hill Head.At weekends the banks are crowded like a beach.It is a clear chalk stream at most 6M wide.It is diverted from the millstream forming a rush deep enough to swim in.The Meon is good for fishing:there are trout,gudgeon,bull_ heads,minnows,crayfish and eels.A fibreglass rod is best with weights, floats,a reel and landing nets.We fly ledger and coarse fish.Bait:_ worms, bread,minnows and maggots.Sometimes herons are seen flying above the river One house has a trout pond.Sheep graze by the river in winter.The mill has just changed hands.A few homes in the village have swimming pools.School children learn to swim at Bishops Waltham_Ridgemede School.They also learn the Blue Cross water safety code.
